alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; Lexington; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 11:19PM EDT until June 26 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Newberry County in central South Carolina... North central Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Northwestern Lexington County in central South Carolina... Saluda County in central South Carolina... * Until 1145 PM EDT. * At 1119 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Saluda, or 14 miles west of Batesburg-Leesville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Batesburg-Leesville, Saluda, Saluda County Airport, Summit, Monetta, Cedar Grove Fire Station, South Shore Marina, Saluda Co Sheriff`s Office, Good Hope, Northside Fire Station Main, Hollywood Elementary School, Camp Kinard, Emory, Delmar, Fredonia, Fairview Fire Station, Pleasant Lane, Wyses Ferry, Lake Murray Shores and Scurry Airport. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 40 and 41. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Murray move away from the water and take shelter!
